title: 112_hr1149
content: The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel as a type of cellulosic biofuel with specific criteria for its classification and greenhouse gas emissions. The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel. The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel for the Cellulosic Biofuel Producer Credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Clean Air Act is amended to include algae-based biofuel in the definition of cellulosic biofuel for the Cellulosic Biofuel Producer Credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes specific provisions for qualified algae-based biofuel production, defining it as algae-based biofuel produced by the taxpayer and sold for use by another person. The taxpayer can sell algae-based biofuel for use in production, as fuel, or for retail sale. The production must not include purchased alcohol. The taxpayer can sell algae-based biofuel for use in production or as fuel, excluding purchased alcohol. Algae-based biofuel includes liquid fuels like gasoline, diesel, aviation fuel, and ethanol. Algae-based biofuel, derived from algal organisms, meets EPA registration requirements under the Clean Air Act. Algal organisms are aquatic, non-vascular plants like microalgae, blue-green algae, and seaweeds. Alcohol is excluded from this definition. Algae-based biofuel, derived from algal organisms, meets EPA registration requirements under the Clean Air Act. The definition of algae-based biofuel excludes alcohol with a proof of less than 150. Amendments to the Code include adding "algae-based" to certain sections related to cellulosic biofuels. Amendments to the Code include adding "algae-based" to certain sections related to cellulosic biofuels, specifying that biofuels must be produced and used in the United States to qualify for the producer credit. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include adding "algae-based" to sections related to cellulosic biofuels and specifying eligibility criteria for biofuel plant property. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes adding "algae-based" to sections related to cellulosic biofuels and specifying eligibility criteria for qualified algae-based biofuel plant property. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes adding "algae-based" to sections related to cellulosic biofuels and specifying eligibility criteria for qualified algae-based biofuel plant property. The amendments define algae-based biofuel as liquid fuel produced from algal organisms, including microalgae, blue-green algae, and macroalgae. Effective dates for the amendments are specified for fuel production after December 31, 2008, and property purchased and placed in service after the same date.
